About Mentor's guide

Do you want to help bring new talent into the tech industry?

How it works

You become a mentor to others
We help them get prepared for the job market
Together, we make the tech industry more diverse

How do I become a mentor?

Our teachers and mentors are all volunteers. They play a vital role in supporting and preparing the students as well as possible for landing their first developer job.

Who are the volunteers?

Rasmus Jones, Post-doctoral Researcher at KADK

"I met really nice people at HackYourFuture"

Niels Schmidt, Co-founder/CTO at anna

"Volunteering is about helping (...) I can share things that are important to me, and maybe they will help others. And at HackYourFuture people really want to learn."

Markus Obelitz, Engineering Manager at Abtion

"I care about equality, I also like teaching (...) and this is a cool way of doing it –– to help someone build a career."

Vlad Zavalykhatko, Lead Developer at TrainAway

"I heard a lot of stories about HYF, about how they help people –– and I wanted to become part of it."

Why HackYourFuture?

We aim to train refugees, asylum seekers, and other disadvantaged groups to become web-developers and empower them by opening the doors to an in-demand job market.

We believe talented newcomers are a great opportunity for society and we are here to give them a helping hand to make use of their potential.

Supporters

LG Insight Evaluation report

This evaluation offers numbers examined by an independent third
party so you know what to expect when you graduate from HackYourFuture
or plan to hire a HackYourFuture graduate.
